title.value: The Leukemoid Reaction in Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis: A Case Report
title.justification: The title is explicit in the document provided; it's a standard case report without ambiguity.
title.quote: The Leukemoid Reaction in Severe Alcoholic Hepatitis: A Case Report

extractions.description: This paper presents a case report on a 35-year-old male with severe alcoholic hepatitis and leukemoid reaction, emphasizing the clinical presentation, laboratory findings, and management approach including corticosteroid therapy.

type.justification: The paper describes a specific medical case, supported by empirical observations and laboratory test results, typical for an empirical study.
type.quote: Our case report adds to the limited literature on this topic, highlighting the importance of recognizing and managing this severe complication.

name.justification: The paper deals primarily with a medical case, particularly in internal medicine related to liver disease.
The condition described, alcoholic hepatitis, directly relates to hepatology, which is a subfield of medicine.
name.quote: AH is a clinicopathological illness that presents as acute to subacute liver failure.

name.justification: Hematology is relevant due to the focus on leukocytosis and leukemoid reaction, which are disorders of the blood.
name.quote: The leukemoid reaction (LR) is characterized by a strikingly raised granulocyte count of 40,000-50,000 cells/mm^3

name.justification: The gastrointestinal aspects are implied by the context of liver disease and alcoholic abuse within medical gastroenterology.
name.quote: Alcoholic hepatitis (AH) is a clinicopathological illness...
